channel.title: Webclient Help
channel.description:
Okay...so my webclient just all of a sudden started giving me this error
load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
- I have deleted the client class and recompiled making a new one so it's there -It is aiming at correct directory - The jar file itself works perfectly fine -This only happens on the webclient

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

If this is only happening on your web-client there’s only a few possible options.

1.)Wherever you are hosting this at maybe change it, could be an issue with them your client might be fine.
2.)What changes if any were made right before the client stopped working?
3.)Check all obvious reasons it might not be working…this may not seem like advice but ive spent hours on the most simple of problems, the only reason Im saying this is because it seems like you have everything set up properly it could be simple you should double check everything.

Disclaimer: I’m just trying to help. I’ve seen some of your work and I’m not on your level, so please don’t take my head off if this doesn’t fix your problem. I hope this helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:440344”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=543019.msg3981377#msg3981377 date=1335306212]
All I am saying is I’ve made thousands of jarred/signed clients before. I have never had this issue. Something in the client is causing this but I have no idea why.
You should remember how I made the webclient for the server you ran <3
[/quote]
I’ve never had anyone make any webclients for me… O.o
I’ve never run any servers publicly either[/quote]lies! 0.o

you may remember me by allisonabcde12345@live.com/yahoo.com/@gmail.com xD

but yeah… anyway back on topic what in the client could exactly cause this and why?

Read full topic

@Loveandpower wrote:

All I am saying is I’ve made thousands of jarred/signed clients before. I have never had this issue. Something in the client is causing this but I have no idea why.
You should remember how I made the webclient for the server you ran <3

item.title: Webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:3, topic:440344”][quote author=team boy link=topic=543019.msg3980667#msg3980667 date=1335222224]
i think you did somthing wrong when you was jarring?

not sure,
[/quote]I did nothing wrong jarring. Jarring and signing doesn’t even have anything remotely related to reading of the classes lol.

It works perfectly in the jar format as well. However, when an applet tag used it gives the error.[/quote]
Jarring/Manifestation has everything to do with your problem. Not saying it is the problem, but don’t go around negating solutions because of what you think.

It most likely has something to do with your init method in the client class… Or manifestation

Read full topic

Okay…so my webclient just all of a sudden started giving me this error

load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
